DataElement.preferredName: Lesion Alteration Noncontrast-enhancing Tissue (nCET) Crosses Midline Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A indication as to whether the nCET (Non-contrast enhancing tissue) crosses the midline is defined by any nCET tumor that extends into the contralateral hemisphere through white matter commissures (exclusive of herniated ipsilateral tissue).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Lesion Alteration Noncontrast-enhancing Tissue Cross Midline
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: (LEE-zhun) An area of abnormal tissue change._A change resulting in something that is different from the original._Visibly abnormal tissue on a magnetic resonance image (MRI) or computed tomography (CT) that does not enhance with contast and is not edema._Travel across or pass over._A medial line, especially the medial line or medial plane of the body (or some part of the body).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: (LEE-zhun) An area of abnormal tissue change.:A change resulting in something that is different from the original.

Concepts.definition: A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part.
The act or process of modifying something.

Property.preferredDefinition: Visibly abnormal tissue on a magnetic resonance image (MRI) or computed tomography (CT) that does not enhance with contast and is not edema.:Travel across or pass over.:A medial line, especially the medial line or medial plane of the body (or some part of the body).

Concepts.definition: Visibly abnormal tissue on a magnetic resonance image (MRI) or computed tomography (CT) that does not enhance with contrast and is not edema.
A medial line, especially the medial line or medial plane of the body (or some part of the body).
